Interface Company

public interface Company

An abstraction of a Company.

Version:
Summer 2013
Author:
Franklin University

Field Summary

          The maximum number of products that a company can have.

Field Detail

MAX_PRODUCTS

static final int MAX_PRODUCTS
The maximum number of products that a company can have.

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Method Detail

add

boolean add(Product prod)
Add a product to the company. The parameter product should not be something already in the company. As a result of adding a product, the company will issue an ID starting with 1 and increasing by 1 for each product added. IDs are not reused. All products are kept in a database internal to the company so that they may be searched for using a query.

Parameters:
prod - The product to add.
Returns:
true when the product is added, false if the product cannot be added for any reason.

allProducts

Product[] allProducts()
Returns the entire internal collection of products as an array. If there are no products, returns an array of Product with length = 0.

Returns:
an array of all existing products.

findProducts

Product[] findProducts(Lookup query)
Create and return an array of products what match the given query criteria. The query will identify which products match. The length of the returned array should be equal to the number of products that match, and each element in the array should be a matching product.

Parameters:
query - a query indicating which products to find
Returns:
an array of matching products.

getProductCount

int getProductCount()
Return the number of products presently in the company.

Returns:
the number of products.

remove

boolean remove(Product prod)
Remove a product. The parameter prod should be a product in the company. The specified product is located in the database and removed.

Parameters:
prod - The product to remove.
Returns:
true if the product was found and removed, false otherwise.

writeToFile

void writeToFile(java.lang.String fileName)
Writes the current company to the given file name using object serialization.

Parameters:
fileName - the name of the file to write.
